main event: On July 23, 1949, multiple witnesses in Darien, Georgia reported seeing a mysterious light in the sky. The light first appeared as a strong white light with an afterglow, streaking across the southern sky from east to west, then it became the color of flame and disappeared instantaneously as though it had been turned off with an electrical switch.
interesting points: Multiple witnesses, including those in a car and others driving along the highway, saw the phenomenon.
The sighting lasted less than a minute and occurred on a cloudy night with no stars visible.
The light traveled with far greater speed than that of any aircraft ever seen in the area.
The report concludes that the object was an 'Astro (METEOR)' and provides a brief summary of its appearance and disappearance.
The document was submitted to Headquarters Third Army and subsequently forwarded to the Commanding General of the Air Materiel Command at Wright-Patterson Air Force Base.
witnesses: multiple witnesses, including individuals in a car and others driving along the highway
